intro: Coffea ligustroides, commonly known as the Brazilian coffee tree, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to South America, particularly Brazil, and is known for its small, dark green leaves and fragrant white flowers. The plant produces red, fleshy berries that contain the seeds used to make coffee. It is often cultivated for its aromatic and flavorful coffee beans, though it is less commonly grown than other coffee species. The plant thrives in tropical climates with high humidity and well-drained soil.
